Description: The Flight into Egypt, after Martin Schongauer; the Virgin on a donkey with the Child in her arms, St Joseph grasping some fruit from a palm tree aided by angels; in the right background a turreted town. c.1495-1500 Engraving
Curator's comments: This engraving belongs to a group of eight unsigned prints which Hind tentatively attributed to Robetta, but now generally accepted as autograph (apart from two that appear to be questionable: see P&D 1845-8-25-801). It is an early work, in which the figures still show a certain stiffness and awkwardness. Another impression is in Dresden. For a discussion of Robetta's oeuvre see Hind D.II.4 (P&D Kk.8.30). The entire composition is a reverse and simplified copy of Schongauer's 'Flight into Egypt' (Bartsch 7; Hollstein 7), while the turreted town in the background is borrowed from Dürers Choice of Hercules (Bartsch 73; Hollstein 63). From its dimensions and shape the engraving was possibly engraved on the same plate as the 'Man of Sorrow' (Hind D.II.39; M. J. Zucker, 'The Illustrated Bartsch, Commentary', vol. 25, part 2, 1984, p. 549, no. 024).
Bibliographic references: Hind 1938-48 / Early Italian Engraving, a critical catalogue (D.II.38)
Hollstein / German engravings, etchings and woodcuts c.1400-1700 (7 d) (Copy after Schongauer)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: A E Evans & Sons
